21-0111.summary: Recommendation to approve the minutes of the Housing Authority of the City of Long Beach, California Special Meeting held Tuesday,Page 1 of 3TELECONFERENCE, 4:30 PMTUESDAY, FEBRUARY 9, 2021CITY OF LONG BEACHHOUSING AUTHORITY OF THE CITY OF LONG BEACH, CALIFORNIA MINUTESJanuary 12, 2021.A motion was made by Commissioner Price, seconded by Commissioner Uranga, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 8 - Allen, Supernaw, Mungo, Austin, Richardson, Tanzer, Saro and ZendejasAbsent: 3 - Price, Uranga and Hudson2.

21-0112.summary: Recommendation to receive and file the Housing Authority Financial and Operational Performance Reports for November 2020.  (Citywide)A motion was made by Commissioner Price, seconded by Richardson, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 10 - Allen, Price, Supernaw, Mungo, Uranga, Austin, Richardson, Tanzer, Saro and ZendejasAbsent: 1 - Hudson3.

21-0113.summary: Recommendation to adopt Specifications No. RFP HE20-046 and award a contract to Emphasys Software, of Petoskey, MI, for implementation of a business management system, in an amount not to exceed $1,100,000 for a period of five years, with the option to renew for three additional one-year periods, at the discretion of the Housing Authority Director; and authorize Housing Authority, or designee, to execute all documents necessary to enter into the contract, including any necessary amendments.  (Citywide)A motion was made by Commissioner Austin, seconded by Vice Chair Saro, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 8 - Allen, Supernaw, Uranga, Austin, Richardson, Tanzer, Saro and ZendejasAbsent: 3 - Price, Mungo and HudsonPage 2 of 3TELECONFERENCE, 4:30 PMTUESDAY, FEBRUARY 9, 2021CITY OF LONG BEACHHOUSING AUTHORITY OF THE CITY OF LONG BEACH, CALIFORNIA MINUTES4.

21-0114.summary: Recommendation to authorize City Manager, or designee, to execute all documents necessary for a Second Amendment to the Lease between Dignity Health, a California nonprofit public benefit corporation, and the Housing Authority of the City of Long Beach, for leasing of approximately 395 rentable square feet of office space.  (Citywide)A motion was made by Commissioner Supernaw, seconded by Commissioner Uranga, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 10 - Allen, Price, Supernaw, Mungo, Uranga, Austin, Richardson, Tanzer, Saro and ZendejasAbsent: 1 - Hudson5.
